channel.title: Syndication on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Syndication on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: The West Texas measles outbreak has ended
item.description: A measles outbreak that killed two children is now over.

item.title: How a mysterious particle could explain the Universe’s missing antimatter
item.description: New experiments focused on understanding the enigmatic neutrino may offer insights.

item.title: Upcoming DeepSeek AI model failed to train using Huawei’s chips
item.description: Startup encountered persistent technical issues using Huawei Ascend chips.

item.title: OpenAI, cofounder Sam Altman to take on Neuralink with new startup
item.description: Sam Altman says we could soon have “high-bandwidth brain-computer interfaces.”

item.title: China tells Alibaba, ByteDance to justify purchases of Nvidia AI chips
item.description: Move comes after negotiating an export agreement with the US.

item.title: Experiment will attempt to counter climate change by altering ocean
item.description: Gulf of Maine will be site of safety and effectiveness testing.

item.title: NASA plans to build a nuclear reactor on the Moon—a space lawyer explains why
item.description: Nuclear power could be the linchpin for long-term human activity.

item.title: Encryption made for police and military radios may be easily cracked
item.description: An encryption algorithm can have weaknesses that could allow an attacker to listen in.

item.title: National Academies to fast-track a new climate assessment
item.description: Move comes in response to government’s questioning of climate science.

item.title: President Trump says Intel’s new CEO “must resign immediately”
item.description: President accuses semiconductor industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan of being “highly conflicted.”

item.title: States take the lead in AI regulation as federal government steers clear
item.description: All 50 states have introduced AI-related legislation this year.

item.title: “Red meat allergy” from tick bites is spreading both in US and globally
item.description: Remember to check for ticks after your next stroll through the woods or long grasses.

item.title: Idaho has become the wild frontier of vaccination policy and public health
item.description: Idaho charts a new path as trust in public health craters.

item.title: Five children see HIV viral loads vanish after taking antiretroviral drugs
item.description: The first widespread success in curing HIV may come from children, not adults.

item.title: China claims Nvidia built backdoor into H20 chip designed for Chinese market
item.description: US semiconductor giant is trying to revive sales in the country.

item.title: VPN use soars in UK after age-verification laws go into effect
item.description: Proton VPN sign-ups originating in the UK increased by over 1,400 percent.

item.title: EPA plans to ignore science, stop regulating greenhouse gases
item.description: “Largest deregulatory action” in the history of US would be one of the unhealthiest.

item.title: Trump promised a drilling boom, but US energy industry hasn’t been interested
item.description: Exec: “Liberation Day chaos and tariff antics have harmed the domestic energy industry."

item.title: Fermented meat with a side of maggots: A new look at the Neanderthal diet
item.description: Researchers reconstruct ancient diets by studying stable nitrogen isotope ratios.

item.title: Microsoft to stop using China-based teams to support Department of Defense
item.description: The tech giant has relied on global workforce to support federal clients.

item.title: Inventor claims bleach injections will destroy cancer tumors
item.description: A lack of medical training isn’t stopping a man from charging $20,000 for the treatment.

item.title: Nvidia AI chips worth $1B smuggled to China after Trump export controls
item.description: Black market for US semiconductors operates despite efforts to curb Beijing’s high-tech ambitions.

item.title: Trump wants to “eliminate or expedite” environmental rules for rocket launches
item.description: SpaceX, other commercial launch firms, have been seeking this change in policy.

item.title: Win for chemical industry as EPA shutters scientific research office
item.description: Companies feared rules and lawsuits based on Office of Research and Development assessments.

item.title: UK backing down on Apple encryption backdoor after pressure from US
item.description: UK officials fear their insistence on backdoor endangers tech deals with US.

item.title: Southwestern drought likely to continue through 2100, research finds
item.description: Weather patterns that drive drought in the Southwest may persist for several decades.

item.title: RFK Jr. wants to change program that stopped vaccine makers from leaving US market
item.description: RFK Jr. is targeting a little-known program that underpins childhood immunizations in the US.

item.title: EU presses pause on probe of X as US trade talks heat up
item.description: EU will miss self-imposed deadline to wrap up investigation.

item.title: Rough road to “energy dominance” after GOP kneecaps wind and solar
item.description: Experts argue that Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act will increase costs for consumers.

item.title: BYD has caught up with Tesla in the global EV race. Here’s how.
item.description: With technology gap narrowed, BYD is poised to outsell Tesla this year.

item.title: Why Gov. Greg Abbott won’t release his emails with Elon Musk
item.description: The governor’s office says some emails contain “intimate and embarrassing” information.

item.title: 5 big EV takeaways from Trump’s “One Big Beautiful Bill”
item.description: Experts have advice for how the EV-curious buyer might navigate this tricky moment.

item.title: In the Southwest, solar panels can help both photovoltaics and crops
item.description: Solar arrays can shade crops from sun while moisture cools the panels to increase their productivity.

item.title: In the Southwest, solar panels in can help both photovoltaics and crops
item.description: Solar arrays can shade crops from sun while moisture cools the panels to increase their productivity.
